verbose_text: Based on the history of ingestion of " Blue Thunder " fuel which may contain varying amounts of methanol (43-77%) and nitromethane (5-35%) and the presence of a large osmolal gap even after accounting for the contribution of the nitromethane, we recommended treatment with fomepizole, thiamine (the patient was suspected to be an alcoholic), folate, and transfer to a facility with dialysis capabilities.
